condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1. The revised law on disability is submitted to and approved by Disability Action Council (DAC) 2. The extent to which DAC/PDAC coordination mechanism has been strengthened 3. Degree to which commune investment plans in target areas are aligning with NDSP and promoting relevant services 4. Share (%) of designated LM budgets allocated to programs/sub-programs for delivery of disability services

comment.narrative: 1. (2018): Not submit and approve yet 2. (2018): The Prakas of establishing the Provincial DAC 3. (2018): N/A.

1. The disability law has been amended and approved by Disability Action Council 2. 5 Coordination meeting organized by the Provincial DACs 3. 10% of commune budget has been allocated to disability service 4. 3% of national budget increased for disability service at line ministries

1. Through technical support from UNDP, DAC significantly improved their capacity to develop and review the policy and legal framework related to disability, for instance, the national disability law is being finalized. The national disability law was drafted in close consultation with line ministries, organizations of persons with disabilities, UN agencies, CSOs to ensure the inclusive participation and enabled full participations from different stakeholders. The national disability law was developed and aligned with the UNCRPD and other international legal frameworks related to disability and human rights based approach. The final national disability law will be expected to submit to the Council of Minister in early 2022.
Meanwhile, DAC also provided technical support to the Ministry of Land Management, Urban Planning and Construction to issue the national circular to notify all Provincial of Land Management, Urban Planning and Construction to strengthen the implementation of the physical accessibility infra-structure for persons with disabilities in August 2021. The national circular also stated that all new construction plans should provide physical accessibility for persons with disabilities. The Ministry of Interior issued the Prakas on Organization and Function of the Committee In-Charge of Women and Children (CWC) in Commune/Sangkat in September 2020 that included a DPO representation to be a member of the CWC. The Ministry of Planning adopted the Washington Group Short Set of Questions on Disability to be included in the revised ID Poor questionnaire. It is expected to be finalized in early 2022. The Implementation Guideline on Vocational Training and Employment Support for Persons with Disability was drafted by the Ministry of Social Welfare Veterans and Youth Rehabilitation (MoSVY). It will be launched in early 2022.
2. The project made effective progress towards the coordination and advisory roles of DAC to promote the implementation of the National Disability Strategic Plan 2019-2023 (NDSP2). As a result, DAC created M&E taskforce to closely monitor the implementation of the NDSP2 at both national and sub national level. DAC strengthened role and function of the five piloted Provincial DACs, including Siem Reap, Battambang, Kampong Cham, Kampong Speu and Tbong Khmum provinces to ensure they have full capacity to implement the NDSP2 at sub national. Significantly, the five Provincial DACs successfully implemented its action plan for 2021 and in the final process of finalizing the 2022 action plan. DAC also built inclusive participation environment for persons with disabilities by engaged them in the key taskforce and working groups. Regular meeting was conducted to provide effective responses and supports to the needs of persons with disabilities on the ground. 13 coordination meetings with 413 (139 women) participants to monitor the progress of the action plans and shared lessons learnt. In 2021, 28,766 persons with disabilities have access to the national disability allowance nationwide.
3. In terms of capacity development, with support from UNDP, five disabled People’s Organizations (DPOs) and one Women with Disabilities Forum (WWDF) improved their communication and advocacy skill to advocate with 12 commune councils to raise the needs of persons with disabilities in the Commune Investment Plan (CIP). As a result, 60 activities were submitted and adopted by 12 communes for 2022 budget. The activities have been designed in line with NDSP2. In addition to the commune budget, 34 (57%) out of 60 activities were supported from different sources - development fund and local fund to cover those activities.
4. The project made significant contributions to disability inclusive social protection in Cambodia. 61,426 persons with disabilities have access to the national cash transfer programme during the Covid-19 pandemic. 221,873 (104,570 women) persons with disabilities registered for disability identification cards and fully access to disability allowance in 2022. Importantly, 8,768 (4,204 women) persons with disabilities have access to job employment in both public and private sector. The Ministry of Interior formally announced 5% of the provincial administration budget allocated specifically for social protection including disability service.

1. The disability law has been amended and approved by Disability Action Council 2. 5 Coordination meeting organized by the Provincial DACs 3. 10% of commune budget has been allocated to disability service 4. 2% of national budget increased for disability service at line ministries

UNDP’s support to build the capacity of the Disability Action Council (DAC) and Cambodian Disabled People’s Organizations (DPOs) to advance disability rights in Cambodia revealed significant results in 2020. Through the leadership of DAC, the final draft of the National Disability Law amendment was completed by the end of 2020. By making this amendment Cambodia will have a stronger disability law that can better advocate for the rights of persons with disabilities (PwDs) and which complies with the UN Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities.
In addition to the amendment to the disability law, a number of policies were finalized and submitted for endorsement in 2020 to advance the rights of persons with disabilities. These include endorsement of the Inter-ministerial Prakas on the Driving License for Persons with Disabilities, drafting of the Inter-Ministerial Prakas on the Discount of School Fees and Stationeries for Students with Disabilities, and the finalization of the M&E framework and action plan matrix for the National Disability Strategic Plan 2 which is expected to be endorsed early next year. UNDP support ensured the full participation of persons with disabilities at all stages of consultations for these critical policies. The capacity of DPOs to advocate for disability rights with local authorities was also improved, resulting in 1,405 people with disabilities (PwDs) (695 women) receiving ID poor cards in 2020 to ensure their access to Government support programmes, including the emergency cash transfer for those affected by COVID-19. The change in mindset and perceptions of local authorities towards PwDs has also been visible through their facilitation and provision of accommodation for persons with disabilities to join the community meetings during the commune investment planning exercise .
20% of women with disabilities in leadership roles at these organizations. Two of the 5 Deputy General Directors of DAC collaborating with UNDP are women. This has ensured that the unique needs of women and girls with disabilities are recognized in decision-making processes and advocacy efforts. As a result, 695 women of 1,405 (49%) PwDs have access to the national cash transfer programme through DPO advocacy to local authorities.
